reviewText:
Pros- Free to play and not P2W.
- Nice graphics/particles/UI/Artwork
- Has a fat, pirate lady as a playable character.
- Really nice map designs.
- Quick, fun matches.

Cons- Battle system. It feels almost same in every character. Only difference is attack range and skills...
- Needs more game modes.
- No assist system. It should give you assist when you did half of the damage or when you healed your teammates.

Suggestions- Better communication system. Such as microphone chat or radio messages. Also please let us change chat buttons. I am used to press Y and U" to chat.
- Do not cap FPS at 60. Just give us an option in settings.
- In game currency that you can gain by playing.
- For beta
date: make a quick "bug report" form instead of "send feedback" form.\n- In game tutorial. Even though i read the tutorial page 2 times
recommended: i didn't understand when i started.\n- Ability to host servers (local and multiplayer).\n- Map editor. Maybe not now
hoursPlayed:
but in the future...
- Bots should be able to play more characters.
- Mute and Report buttons in TAB menu.

Even though cons are more dominant
voteText: i recommend this game. Remember that this game is just few days old. I think it has potential!"

reviewText:
I'm a mainly competitive gamer and this is a good break from those games that make you salty, or put you on tilt. Play 10-20 matches and you'll love the game. It's not really complicated, but there are little tricks that you can do to make you that much better than your opponent, like bounce jumping with the healer.

Con:
Not enough people on it. That's my ONLY problem with it. I'm looking at the servers at different times of the day, and recently it has been hard to find a game with enough people.


For those who haven't tried it yet, and have a competitive nature to you, come try the game. It's more fun than it looks, trust me.

reviewText:

Free, no pay to win elements, its still in beta, the development team is very responsive, basically an awesome game to enjoy and pick up !!.

What are you waiting for, see you in game !

reviewText:
Veeeeery fun game! It has this in-battle-class-change thing where you can choose from the three classes you put in your loadout! There are 6 classes in total and you bring three of them into each battle, if that makes it a bit clearer. :D
The devs have plans of microtransactions, but that is reserved probably for pets, skins and stuff which does not act as a gamechanger (I hope xD )
It is fast paced, full of action, not much thinking to do and highly addictive! Unfortunately, servers are pretty empty at the moment, so check out the video I made when I first encountered BattleSouls and see if the game is to your liking and if it is - let's fill up those servers! ;)

reviewText: Total snorefest. Gameplay is bland, everything you do is low impact -- low damage skills, low healing, limited mobility. You feel like you're chipping away at each other with foam darts until one of you dies of boredom. There's no satisfaction of landing a good skill in other MOBAs or making a clutch shot in an FPS.\n\nIf teams aren't completely mismatched in skill, the game is a perpetual stalemate because the respawn timer is about the time needed to cross half the map. This means that after winning a fight at the middle objective (required to make the end objective vulnerable")
date: the entire enemy team will respawn before you can get to their base.\n\nGraphics are generically cartoony
recommended: like TF2 but with low-quality wizard hats. Animation and sound are simple and repetitive
hoursPlayed: which only highlights how low impact your skills are.\n\nThe only interesting feature is the on-the-fly class switching. You choose 3 classes to play (out of 5 classes: 2 ranged DPS
voteText: 1 melee tank
votesHelpful: and 1 support) and can switch between them on a short timer. Each class has a passive skill that triggers when you switch to that class (e.g. the tank has a short duration of invulnerability
votesTotal: support does a small AoE burst heal). I'd love to see this mechanic in a proper game."

reviewText:
Product received for free

Using the warrior to get to your location charging to be faster, switching to the ghost to see where all enemies are, using the ghost to teleport to an enemy. Switching back to the warrior so you get that 3s of invulnerability. Kill an enemy. Enemies are stacking up, back to the ghost for some spread damage. The enemy is running away because they are low on health, quickly switch to the mage and finish them.

I love this game so far.
A very strategic type of combat, switching classes for your abilities, yet you are nothing without your team.

It has a few bugs with the options, I had to play it in window mode because full screen make the game go to my second monitor.
Also the buttons on the option menu are a bit buggy.

I hope we can see quite a lot more characters in this game to play with.

reviewText:
Product received for free

Honestly, probably one of the best free to play games out there, there's a lot of issues but with the game but it's honestly a good a mount of fun and honestly a free to play game and not pay to play, (All purchased items are entirely cosmetic.) If you're looking for a nice little game to kill time on occasionaly I highly reccomend this game. (It's free, stop expecting Fall Out or Call of Duty type gameplay for free to play games.)

My suggestions, new color scheme for the different maps (Different layouts but still look way to much like each other.)
Better team balancing
Health bars for enemies
Better bot AI.
Character balancing (The cannon lady can pretty much point and shoot and gather kills)

All my other notes I'm hoping will end up getting fixed and changed as the game developers progress. (Different maps and gameplays and added characters.) All in all a pretty solid game. 7/10

reviewText:
Battle souls harneses the basic MOBA style gameplay but removes the creeps and standard hero pool".

You can at will swap between 3 different classes that you choose at the start of the match. Allowing each player to effectively be a tank or dps with some even having self heals. You must as a team take cotrol of a point on the map (king of the hill style) before the enemies crystals become vulnerable. This can prove difficult as the crystals tend to be close to the enemys spawn point.

Graphics and animations are quite colourful and unique and fairly high resolution. Sounds could be touched up a little but for alpha they are working well enough. Something to consider for beta/release is how janky the characters feel when they are walking
date:
I feel like a tank when using the potion throwing girl class.

The game is going to be released as F2P with kill effects and other cosmetic items indended to offset development costs. Worth picking up if you have some spare time to help bug test and give feedback or have some friends to play since at this time in ALPHA (just before beta release) the servers seem fairly dead besides bots.

I would give it a 2/5 in its current state
recommended: considering its in alpha and would like to see how they continue to improve the game as development progresses."

reviewText:
Light-hearted, easy to pick up and simply great fun!

I found the character selection, their abilities and the character-swapping mechanic adding a surprising amount of tactical depth to the game. You'll very quickly learn who of your opponents are more skilled at handling this tactical element.

Skill is the only thing that matters here and the game is truly free-to-play. You're able to purchase items but they don't give you any advantage over other players on the battlefield.

Highly recommended :)

reviewText:
Battle Souls is not there yet. You basically pick a combination of 3 classes that can switch mid-battle. There are currently 5 classes to choose from. Warrior, Healer, Vampire, Pirate and Mage. Warrior and Vampire are melee while the rest are ranged. You basically go around capturing inhibitors and destryoing the enemy bases crystal. If you destroy 3 of them before they destroy yours, you win. It's not a novel concept as you can find this in Team Fortress, Unreal or Quake but it's fine.

The game passes but I would compare the game to Overwatch and find that Overwatch is better. This would make me veer towards Overwatch instead of Battle Soul.

PROS
1. Different characters and their special abilities.
It's nice to see someone stepping up to Team Fortress and Overwatch.

2. Ability to switch roles
You can change from DPS, Tank and Support any time you want. Do note that there is a cooldown though and your HP is converted from 1 class to another as a percentage of HP remaining.

CONS
1. High Ping from Players
Horrible game experience when this occurs. The game was good until a high ping player (ms 268) joined the game and thoroughly ruined the experience. The game froze every 3 seconds and nothing moved.

2. Low Player Population
Literally 0 players in their servers. Most of the players were bots.

3. Nothing Novel
The concept of capturing points and destroying the base is so old-fashioned and cliche.

SUGGESTIONS
1. Separating high-ping players from low-ping players.
With such a low player count, I understand that it's hard to do. But

2. Traditional roles
The Sniper class (long range unit), Rogue class (invisibility) and Shield-bearer (Hard Tank).

3. Unique Races
Maybe some non-human units, like a Troll, Werewolf or Orc.

reviewText:
Product received for free

I have a simple rule of thumb: If a game is asking for money, it's okay to critique it. So is the case with Battlesouls. A Very cool idea, which is missing everything but the most basic of features... and a cash shop.


Full review:
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=nNQ8I2bhL3g

Textual:
Battlesouls main concept is selecting a group of 3 characters, each with two abilities and using a hot-switching during a match to switch between them. The goal is to destroy the enemies crystal" 3 times
date: while controlling a central inhibitor structure.\n\nThis part of the game is actually pretty fun for a few hours... but the game lacks any meaningful content outside of this
recommended: which a myriad of other games do as well. My main opinion is that this game is being pushed out to soon
hoursPlayed: to fast and with WAY to little. Being free to play - while having a functional cash-shop - doesn't make it okay by calling it a "Beta".\n\nSo
voteText: what does the game have?\n\n- 5 characters
helpfulPercent:
where you pick 3 at any time
- 2 kill animations (paid)
- A bunch of account icons (paid)
- A quick match with EU servers only.
- 3 maps
- 1 game mode.... that's it.

what doesn't the game have?

- Progression
- Unlocks (except account icons)
- Game modes
- Variety of characters
- Ranked
- Custom games (private or public)


Outside of this: The animations feel "feathery" without weight
votesHelpful: and are very repetitive. The music / sounds are Bare bones and the balance in both characters
votesTotal: re-spawn timers and pickups is just not there.\n\nAs such
votesFunny: there just isn't a way for me to recommend this title. Maybe a year down the line.... but until then
commentsCount: don't spend your money on it."

Battlesouls looks like a great alternative to any intensive shooter that's on the market at the moment and even a great platform for newcomers in the genre. If you want to introduce someone that plays mostly MOBAs, Battlesouls will not only lure them, it will engage them and they won't get owned at the very beginning very often thanks to the team centric goals and easiness of the shooting and movement mechanics.

reviewText:
Product received for free

Video First Impressions:  here
I think that this game has a ways to go before it is polished enough to where I would play it for long durations.  I think that the mechanic of switching between 3 completely different heroes is really cool.  Right now I feel like the mage hero might be a bit more powerful than anyone else.  I think there should be a popup system letting you know that you got a kill or an assist.  The only thing that I was afraid of was that eventually with no in-game progression/leveling system, the game would get very repetitive after a few games.  I see a competitive scene coming to this game in the future.

I received a review copy of this game.  I do not know the developers and did not receive any form of payment for this review.

reviewText:
Well.
It's an early game.
Early 2008 that is.
The concept is original, but the game itself feels.. old and poorly made.
It's really shiny, too shiny, and you die so damn fast for no reason.
Feedback is absent.
C for effort, don't give up.

reviewText:
Product received for free

The first time I write a review for a game and of course it was a bad experience...
I played this game for only 5 minutes with a few bots and real human players. It was super laggy, and all of a sudden, the game wasnt finished just yet, I was returned to the lobby page with an alert saying something about me being a cheater according to Steam. I was like for real?!?! I use cheat on a game that I only played for 5 mins?

Fine, quick uninstall decision :)

reviewText:
Really good game overall. The game itself is fun but right now there are only two maps and one game mode that I have been playing on.  And there are not alot of people.  It will definitely be more fun once more players start to join and when more modes are in rotation.

Its not pay to win by any means, hopefully that wont change.

Looks nice,  runs smoothly, and alot of fun. Not much is wrong with the game other than small player base and hopefully that will change.
